simulated_ratings.title: Crucible, The (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I was absorbed by the tense moral stakes and historical paranoia.

simulated_ratings.feeling: The clever stop‑motion wit and cozy charm hit a sweet spot even if it’s lightweight.

simulated_ratings.title: Mouse Hunt (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The broad slapstick wore thin for me despite a few inventive gags.

simulated_ratings.feeling: The whimsical, interwoven tales intrigued me more than they moved me.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Wall‑to‑wall silliness and stale sequel energy left me cold.
